data.title: The Church of England
data.meta_description: Welcome to our website. We are a Church for all, online and in every community in England and across Europe.
data.text:
A prayer following unrest and violence in the United Kingdom

As a small minority brings hatred, violence and vandalism to towns and cities across the country, a prayer as we condemn the senseless violence unfolding before our eyes and a call to build a cohesive, harmonious society for all.

Worship resources for peace during civil unrest and racial tensions

A new set of prayers in response to the recent civil unrest has been published by the Church of England's Racial Justice Unit, designed for use either in churches or individual prayer.

Develop a daily connection with God

Everyday Faith is the new daily devotional app from the Church of England designed to inspire, equip and encourage you in your faith every day of the week, not just on Sundays.

The app will provide you with carefully curated daily reflections, including selected Bible readings, a simple prayer to prepare you for the day ahead, and thoughts based on that week’s theme.

Vision & Strategy

The Church of England’s vocation is and always has been to proclaim the good news of Jesus Christ afresh in each generation to the people of England.

Learn more about our vision for a simpler, humbler, bolder church.

Israel-Gaza war

Information for parishes and individuals seeking to better understand the Church’s response to the war and guidance on how they can how help whether through prayer, giving or action.

A Service for the Thirteenth Sunday after Trinity

Join us this week from St Mary's, Ely. Rev Phil Marsh and his team will be exploring why Jesus refers to himself as the bread of life and how remarkable the gift of God in Jesus truly is.

Join our online community from 9am on Sunday.
